questionList.qu: A 20W heater heats a 200g sample of water for 30 minutes. Given `c=4.18J kg^(-1)K^(-1)`, how much does the temperature of the water increase?
A 12W heater heats a 100g sample of water for 15 minutes. Given `c=4.18J kg^(-1)K^(-1)`, how much does the temperature of the water increase?
A 5W heater heats a 10g sample of water by `5 K`. Given `c=4.18J kg^(-1)K^(-1)`, how long will it take for the water to increase by this temperature, assuming there is no phase change?
A 15W heater heats a 250g sample of water by `12 K`. Given `c=4.18J kg^(-1)K^(-1)`, how long will it take for the water to increase by this temperature, assuming there is no phase change?

A heater heats a 10g sample by `10 K`, with a heat capacity of `4.18J kg^(-1)K^(-1)`. If the heater takes 5 minutes to warm up the sample, how many watts does the heater use, given that the heater is 80% efficient?
A heater heats a 400g sample by `4 K`, with a heat capacity of `2J kg^(-1)K^(-1)`. If the heater takes 2 minutes to warm up the sample, how many watts does the heater use?
A heater heats a 20g sample by `5 K`, with a heat capacity of `5J kg^(-1)K^(-1)`. If the heater uses 4 watts, how long will it take for the sample to warm up?
A heater heats a 40g sample by `12 K`, with a heat capacity of `7J kg^(-1)K^(-1)`. If the heater uses `x` watts, how long will it take for the sample to warm up?
Which expression correctly represents the power required to heat a 120g sample by `10 K` with a heat capacity of `5J kg^(-1)K^(-1)` in 30 seconds?
Calculate the heat capacity of a sample, given that it takes a 20W heater half a minute to heat a 10g sample by `5 K`
Calculate the heat capacity of a sample, given that it takes a 4W heater 10 minutes to heat a 150g sample by `10 K`
